content.description: This is a fun climb but a little hard to start.  The hard part is probably at the beginning, yes you better not fall there!
content.location: This one is right by the potato chip.  Just up the hill a little bit.

content.description:
This is the mother of all south woodson problems. Start in a right facing overhanging corner with some sweet tight hand and finger locks while you work your way up the corner with some funk. Eventually the crack will pinch down and you will have to crimp and tech your way for another 10 feet to where the crack opens again. Plug in some gear and then figure out the crux sequence over the bulge and then clip a bolt. Motor your you way up to the anchors through a somewhat awkward right leaning crack.

The anchors are accessible by walking up the backside. Either down climb the 4th class boulder to access the anchors or there is a rap station to rappel to the anchors? Not sure why it's there as it didn't really seem necessary, but oh well. If setting up the top rope you may want to clip into a bolt up by the anchors to protect yourself. It's a bit awkward up there.
content.protection: Thin rack with an emphasis on small gear. Doubles from .3-.75 and a few smaller pieces.
content.location:
Call box trail, pass the tortilla chip then make a left at the top and follow that to the big cluster of boulders. Can't miss it.

32.995306, -116.966365

content.description: It looks like a mouth, the OW on the left side right by the trail to the Turkeys area is very nice.
content.location:
This is right on the trail that cuts across the hill to the Turkeys.  I put the GPS too

32.994953, -116.967126

content.description: Sustained Arete slapping with ripples for feet.
content.location: Right Side of the tortilla chip

content.description: This is nice fist or OW crack for you depending on how big you are.  It is right next to the Turkeys, and they put a bolt for safety on top if needed.  There are many bolts in this area, the boulder next door has bolts so you can clip with left or right hand.  Thank you for making these climbs!
content.location:
This is right on the trail to Turkey gone Wild, I put the GPS here.  Good warmup for Turkey Gone Wild.

32.995122, -116.966544

content.description: interesting slanty crack climb, bring your cams people and have a blast!  You will enjoy the exposure feeling no doubt.
content.location:
If you know where the Turkeys going Wild climb is, this is so close to there.  I put the GPS here too,

32.995107, -116.965584

content.description: I found another one!  It has a good wide finish and there are bolts already there for making a toprope ascent.
content.protection: bolts are there for your use!
content.location:
This is close to other things, it's before the potato chip on the right as you climb the hill.  Here are the GPS:

32°59'40.2"N 116°58'14.1"W

32.994485, -116.970579

content.description: This is a crazy rock, sticks up like a big potato chip.  You can climb from many sides but the best one is the easiest back side.  There is a bolt on top too.
content.location:
I can put the coordinates here too  32°59'39.62"N     116°58'13.16"W

The trail from the road is easy and you just keep going up sticking to the biggest trail.  You can't miss it it's right on the trail, maybe 15 minutes hiking.
